javadoc:
Determines where instructions couldn't be matched and where they differ between sets of addresses as provided by a ListingAddressCorrelation. Initially this will be byte differences and instruction operand differences for any instructions that were determined to be matched.
Important: This class is not intended to be used for an entire program. Instead it is for comparing smaller portions such as functions. If the correlation handed to this class associates two large address sets, then the address sets, such as byte differences, that are created by this class could potentially consume large amounts of memory.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a ListingDiff to determine where instructions couldn't be matched and where they 
 differ between sets of addresses as provided by a ListingAddressCorrelation.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a ListingDiff to determine where instructions couldn't be matched and where they 
 differ between sets of addresses as provided by a ListingAddressCorrelation.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the address correlation that is used to determine matching addresses between the two listings. Differences can then be determined where a matching address is found.
Important: This class is not intended to be used for an entire program. Instead it is for comparing smaller portions such as functions. If the correlation handed to this class associates two large address sets, then the address sets, such as byte differences, that are created by this class could potentially consume large amounts of memory. @param correlation the address correlation. Otherwise, null to clear the correlation. @throws MemoryAccessException if memory can't be read.
methods.name: setCorrelation
methods.comment:
Sets the address correlation that is used to determine matching addresses between the two 
 listings. Differences can then be determined where a matching address is found.
 Important: This class is not intended to be used for an entire program. Instead it is 
 for comparing smaller portions such as functions. If the correlation handed to this class 
 associates two large address sets, then the address sets, such as byte differences, that are 
 created by this class could potentially consume large amounts of memory.

params.name: correlation
params.comment: the address correlation. Otherwise, null to clear the correlation.

methods.javadoc:
Determines if this ListingDiff currently has an address correlation to use.
@return true if it has an address correlation currently.
methods.name: hasCorrelation
methods.comment: Determines if this ListingDiff currently has an address correlation to use.

return.comment: true if it has an address correlation currently.

methods.name: getOperandsThatDiffer
methods.comment:
Gets an array containing the operand indices where the two indicated code units differ.
 These differences are determined based on whether constants and registers are
 being ignored.

return.comment:
an array of operand indices where the operands differ between the two code units 
 based on the current settings that indicate what differences can be ignored.

methods.name: doesEntireOperandSetDiffer
methods.comment:
Determines if the entire set of operands should indicate that it differs.
 If the code units aren't the same type then the entire set of operands is considered different.
 Also if the number of operands differs then as far as we're concerned the entire set differs.

return.comment: true if we should indicate that all operands differ.

methods.name: getListing1UnmatchedCode
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the first listing where matching code couldn't be determined in the 
 second listing.

return.comment: the addresses of the unmatched code in the first listing.

methods.name: getListing2UnmatchedCode
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the second listing where matching code couldn't be determined in the 
 first listing.

return.comment: the addresses of the unmatched code in the second listing.

methods.name: getListing1Diffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the first listing where differences were found based on the current 
 difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with differences in the first listing.

methods.name: getListing2Diffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the second listing where differences were found based on the current 
 difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with differences in the second listing.

methods.name: getListing1CodeUnitDiffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the first listing where code unit (mnemonic and/or operand) differences 
 were found based on the current difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with code unit differences in the first listing.

methods.name: getListing2CodeUnitDiffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the second listing where code unit (mnemonic and/or operand) differences 
 were found based on the current difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with code unit differences in the second listing.

methods.name: getListing1ByteDiffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the first listing where byte differences were found based on the 
 current difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with byte differences in the first listing.

methods.name: getListing2ByteDiffs
methods.comment:
Gets the addresses in the second listing where byte differences were found based on the 
 current difference settings.

return.comment: the addresses with byte differences in the second listing.

methods.name: getMatchingAddress
methods.comment:
Gets the matching address from the other listing for the specified address from one
 of the two listings whose differences this class determines.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address whose matching address this determines.

params.name: isListing1
params.comment:
true indicates the address is from the first listing. false indicates
 it is from the second listing.

methods.javadoc:
Outputs an information message, primarily for debugging, that indicates where code was 
 unmatched with the other listing and where various differences, such as bytes and 
 code units, were found.
methods.name: printFunctionComparisonDiffs
methods.comment:
Outputs an information message, primarily for debugging, that indicates where code was 
 unmatched with the other listing and where various differences, such as bytes and 
 code units, were found.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the setting indicating if byte differences are currently being ignored.
@return true if byte differences are being ignored.
methods.name: isIgnoringByteDiffs
methods.comment: Gets the setting indicating if byte differences are currently being ignored.

return.comment: true if byte differences are being ignored.

methods.javadoc:
Changes the setting indicating whether or not byte differences should be ignored.
@param ignore true indicates to ignore byte differences
methods.name: setIgnoreByteDiffs
methods.comment: Changes the setting indicating whether or not byte differences should be ignored.

params.name: ignore
params.comment: true indicates to ignore byte differences

methods.javadoc:
Gets the setting indicating if values of operand constants that differ are currently 
 being ignored when determining code unit differences.
@return true if code unit differences are ignoring differences in values of operand
 constants.
methods.name: isIgnoringConstants
methods.comment:
Gets the setting indicating if values of operand constants that differ are currently 
 being ignored when determining code unit differences.

return.comment:
true if code unit differences are ignoring differences in values of operand
 constants.

methods.javadoc:
Changes the setting indicating if values of operand constants that differ should be 
 ignored when determining code unit differences.
@param ignore true means code unit differences should ignore differences in values of 
 operand constants.
methods.name: setIgnoreConstants
methods.comment:
Changes the setting indicating if values of operand constants that differ should be 
 ignored when determining code unit differences.

params.name: ignore
params.comment:
true means code unit differences should ignore differences in values of 
 operand constants.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the setting indicating if operand registers that differ other than in size
 are currently being ignored when determining code unit differences.
@return true if code unit differences are ignoring operand register differences other 
 than in size.
methods.name: isIgnoringRegisters
methods.comment:
Gets the setting indicating if operand registers that differ other than in size
 are currently being ignored when determining code unit differences.

return.comment:
true if code unit differences are ignoring operand register differences other 
 than in size.

methods.javadoc:
Changes the setting indicating if operand registers that differ other than in size 
 should be ignored when determining code unit differences.
@param ignore true means code unit differences should ignore operand register differences
 other than in size.
methods.name: setIgnoreRegisters
methods.comment:
Changes the setting indicating if operand registers that differ other than in size 
 should be ignored when determining code unit differences.

params.name: ignore
params.comment:
true means code unit differences should ignore operand register differences
 other than in size.

methods.name: addListingDiffChangeListener
methods.comment:
Adds the indicated listener to those that get notified when the ListingDiff's set of 
 differences and unmatched addresses changes.

methods.name: removeListingDiffChangeListener
methods.comment:
Removes the indicated listener from those that get notified when the ListingDiff's set of 
 differences and unmatched addresses changes.

methods.name: getMatchingCodeUnit
methods.comment:
Gets the matching code unit from the other listing for the specified code unit from one
 of the two listings whose differences this class determines.

params.name: codeUnit
params.comment: the code unit whose match this determines.

params.name: isListing1
params.comment:
true indicates the code unit is from the first listing. false indicates
 it is from the second listing.

return.comment: the matching code unit or null

name: ListingDiff
comment:
Determines where instructions couldn't be matched and where they differ between sets of 
 addresses as provided by a ListingAddressCorrelation. Initially this will be byte 
 differences and instruction operand differences for any instructions that were determined 
 to be matched.
 Important: This class is not intended to be used for an entire program. Instead it is 
 for comparing smaller portions such as functions. If the correlation handed to this class 
 associates two large address sets, then the address sets, such as byte differences, that are 
 created by this class could potentially consume large amounts of memory.
